Package io.avery.conveyor

Interface Belt.Sink<In>

Type Parameters:
In - the input element type
All Superinterfaces:
Belt.Stage
All Known Subinterfaces:
Belt.StepSink<In>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ProxySink
Enclosing class:
Belt
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public static non-sealed interface Belt.Sink<In> extends Belt.Stage
A Stage that accepts input elements.

A sink may enclose a downstream station, which will run when the sink runs. Sinks generally should be run before accepting elements, in case the sink connects across a downstream boundary, to avoid the effects of unmitigated buffer saturation (including potential deadlock).

This is a functional interface whose functional method is drainFromSource(StepSource).

    Methods inherited from interface io.avery.conveyor.Belt.Stage

    run

  • Method Details

    • drainFromSource

      boolean drainFromSource(Belt.StepSource<? extends In> source) throws Exception
      Pulls as many elements as possible from the source to this sink. This proceeds until either an exception is thrown, this sink cancels, or this sink is unable to accept more elements from the source (which does not necessarily mean the source drained). Returns true if the source definitely drained, meaning a call to pull returned null; else returns false.
      Parameters:
      source - the source to drain from
      Returns:
      true if the source drained
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to drain
      Implementation Requirements
      Implementors should restrict to pulling from the source. Closing the source is the caller's responsibility, as the source may be reused after this method is called.

      Implementors should document if they concurrently pull from the source, as this is not safe for all sources.

    • complete

      default void complete() throws Exception
      Signals any nearest downstream boundary sources to stop yielding elements that arrive after this signal.
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to complete
      Implementation Requirements
      A linked boundary sink should implement its push and drainFromSource methods to discard elements and return false after this method is called, to prevent unbounded buffering or deadlock. The linked boundary source should return null from pull and false from drainToSink after yielding all values that arrived before it received this signal.

      A sink that delegates to downstream sinks should call complete on each downstream sink before returning from this method, unless this method throws before completing any sinks. If completing any sink throws an exception, subsequent exceptions should be suppressed onto the first exception. If completing any sink throws InterruptedException, the thread interrupt status should be set when the exception is caught, and remain set until any subsequent throw of InterruptedException (in accordance with Stage.run). The utility method Belts.composedComplete(Stream) is provided for common use cases.

      The default implementation does nothing.

    • completeAbruptly

      default void completeAbruptly(Throwable cause) throws Exception
      Signals any nearest downstream boundary sources to stop yielding elements and throw UpstreamException.
      Parameters:
      cause - the causal exception
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to complete
      Implementation Requirements
      A linked boundary sink should implement its push and drainFromSource methods to discard elements and return false after this method is called, to prevent unbounded buffering or deadlock. The linked boundary source should throw an UpstreamException, wrapping the cause passed to this method, upon initiating any subsequent calls to pull or subsequent pushes in drainToSink.

      A sink that delegates to downstream sinks should call completeAbruptly on each downstream sink before returning from this method, even if this method throws. If completing any sink throws an exception, subsequent exceptions should be suppressed onto the first exception. If completing any sink throws InterruptedException, the thread interrupt status should be set when the exception is caught, and remain set until any subsequent throw of InterruptedException (in accordance with Stage.run). The utility method Belts.composedCompleteAbruptly(Stream, Throwable) is provided for common use cases.

      The default implementation does nothing.

      default Belt.Station compose(Belt.StepSource<? extends In> upstream)
